Summary: Render and arrange child nodes inside a component using `Children()`; build layout wrappers that customize child placement.
Remarks: Components derive from `Component` and implement `Render()` to compose views. Use `Children()` to access child nodes passed from the parent, enabling container components that arrange/transform children (similar to React's `props.children`). Combine with `[Prop]` inputs to parameterize layout (e.g., `ColumnCount`) and apply logic to set grid row/column or other placement. Keep child handling pure and deterministic; avoid side effects while positioning. This pattern is ideal for reusable layout primitives that remain declarative and MVU-friendly.
